p: Viral loads are higher at the time of symptom onset and are higher in nose than in throat specimens [ 39, 40]. Furthermore, in patients affected by COVID-19, viral load progressively decreases within days, following a different pattern from SARS in which the highest shedding is recorded after 10Â days from symptom onset [ [39], [40], [41]]. These findings suggest that SARS-CoV-2 may spread more easily in the community than SARS even when initial mild symptoms or no symptoms are present.
